Home.title: Where Trauma Awareness Meets Societal Change

first.title: What is the Forum?
first.par: The Forum for Trauma and Nervous System is a feel, do and think tank, it is a transformation vision to join in. Our thesis is that the individual and collective state of our nervous system determines the state of our world. In order for a sustainable, positive change in the world, it makes sense to look at the causes of conflicts and crises in our nervous systems, instead of working ...
first.fullText:
The Forum for Trauma and Nervous System is a feel, do and think tank, it is a transformation vision to join in. Our thesis is that the individual and collective state of our nervous system determines the state of our world. In order for a sustainable, positive change in the world, it makes sense to look at the causes of conflicts and crises in our nervous systems, instead of working just on the symptoms. Only if there are more safe spaces for all people and therefore more regulated nervous systems, we can find solutions to the challenges that our global society is facing. 

All people have their own individual trauma structures, their own stories, survival mechanisms and life circumstances. But they all have a nervous system that functions according to exactly the same principles. And very few people are aware of these principles. Very few grow up knowing that stress and danger activate the amygdala and inhibit the cerebral cortex, which is responsible for cognitive abilities. How many students are labelled as unschoolable or not smart just because they lack safety and their amygdala is strongly activated? What a huge potential would arise if society offered these children safe spaces, e.g. at school, in which their amygdala could relax and the inhibition of the cerebral cortex could be lifted. 

Life courses that are characterised by addiction, poverty, crime, violence or mental illness are closely linked to traumatic experiences. What would happen if we as a society did not tackle the symptoms by bearing the costs of police operations, prisons, psychiatric drugs, psychiatrists, social workers etc.,but instead tackle the causes directly and invest in safe spaces. What would a society look like in which there were more safe spaces and thus more capable cerebral cortexes? How much potential would unfold? If people had safe spaces to develop, would there still be a shortage of skilled labour and would prisons, hospitals and psychiatric wards etc. still be as busy as they are today? How would the school system change? How would politics be organised? What impact would this have on the media and culture? 

To find out, the Forum for Trauma and the Nervous System is embarking on a journey towards a trauma-informed and nervous system-friendly society. The Forum for Trauma and the Nervous System is a practical and holistic transformational movement that connects all relevant levels. We want that the knowledge about trauma and the nervous system to be part of the basic education, just like arithmetic, reading and writing. We strive for all social structures to be aligned with the principles of the human nervous system. 

From trauma-informed and nervous system-oriented puplic authorities, schools, universities, prisons and hospitals to a regenerative corporate world, trauma-sensitive media, pornography, sex work, non-governmental organisations and a nervous system-friendly language and culture. The need for change is as unlimited as the possibilities that arise from a nervous system-orientated approach. And we would be delighted if you join in, in a way that suits your nature, your nervous system and your life situation.

second.title: What are our basic principles?
second.par: In all its activities and manifestations, the Forum is guided by basic principles that give us orientation. The basic principles and the human image behind them are the compass that guides our actions and is the link and common foundation of an emerging global network with all its diversity. Basic principles: 1. the principle of the 2 pillars Like a pendulum, the forum swings back and forth between the pillar of 'going outwards' in the form of passing...
second.fullText: In all its activities and manifestations, the Forum is guided by basic principles that give us orientation. The basic principles and the human image behind them are the compass that guides our actions and is the link and common foundation of an emerging global network with all its diversity. Basic principles: 1. the principle of the 2 pillars Like a pendulum, the forum swings back and forth between the pillar of 'going outwards' in the form of passing on knowledge to society and the pillar of 'going inwards' in the form of creating safe spaces in which we look within ourselves and perceive and integrate our shadows. 2. storytelling The forum brings the issue of trauma together with the issue of social justice and creates a powerful vision of a trauma-informed, more just and peaceful society with effective social systems. 3. shame avoidance and self-image retention ...are powerful driving forces within ourselves that cause us to block out those aspects of reality that draw our attention to our own inner pain and reflect our own incompleteness. In order to avoid shame and maintain our self-image, we create stories about ourselves and the world. In the forum, we discover and question these stories. We are honest with ourselves and others and treat each other lovingly from the outset as vulnerable and unfinished beings. We draw our strength from this honesty and transparency and meet the outside world at eye level. 4. multi-perspectivity The central starting point is to focus on the perspective of those 'affected' by the support systems and not to make the process of generating and passing on knowledge a 'white' bourgeois bubble. We are aware of the limitations of our own perspectives and try to integrate as many social perspectives as possible into the forum. 5 The scaling and effectiveness principle Everything that the Forum builds is geared towards the greatest possible scalability and effectiveness. Knowledge about trauma is to be fed into the systems at the nodes with the greatest reach. To this end, political and civil society structures are specifically integrated. Local groups work in their field of activity, use their representatives' office hours and local networking structures to promote centrally managed campaigns. Working groups and political alliances are formed. In addition to the cognitive level, the heart level and the cell level are also addressed in accompanying training sessions. 6 The principle of transparent shadows Our inner shadow parts are welcome. Instead of hiding them, we bring them to light and practice integrating them lovingly into our self-image. Non-transparent shadow parts are dangerous for the forum as they prevent trauma integration. We will often not meet our standards because this does not yet allow our development as individuals and as energy bodies. We make the discrepancy between aspiration and reality transparent. We will also receive financial support generated by exploitative capitalism. We also make the shadows of the resources made available to us transparent. 7 The principle of organic hierarchy The forum shows itself to us with varying degrees of clarity. The more clearly someone can see and feel the forum, the more decision-making authority the person has. The forum is flexible and clear in its work. It will grow quickly. The slowness of grassroots democratic decision-making is not suitable for the forum in the first few years. The 2-pillar principle provides safe spaces for slowness, pausing, feeling, and healing. 8 The principle of harmony Controversial discussions and the bursting force of intense feelings are welcome and are part of a healthy and vibrant energy body. Power struggles are not part of this healthy vitality. Striving for power may and should be reflected in a safe space and transformed into growth. However, it is not possible to change the foundations of the forum on its journey. Inner ruptures with the forum can and will lead to partings and re-encounters. Those who cannot support the forum can go their own way for a while until their soul can reconnect with the forum. 9 The principle of listening Every being can and should contribute to the forum according to their abilities and interests. Where does my soul and my body feel at the right place? We listen into ourselves, to the universe and to life to hear what we are being called to do. This can create new fields of action, inside and outside the forum. 10 Spirituality In the forum we practice connecting with our higher self. Free from religious dogma, we establish a spiritual practice that is completely voluntary and comfortable even for atheists. 11. regenerative working We try to adapt workplaces to the respective individual needs of the nervous system and to design working conditions, including the salary structure, in a joint process. 12. research space for social transformation We are guided by the desire to open a research space for sustainable social action and new social structures. We see a need to contribute to change, as we recognize that a nervous system-oriented and trauma-sensitive life and work is made more difficult by the current social and economic system.

third.title: Our view of the human being
third.par: ...is based on the work of Martinus Thomsen's cosmology and is characterized by the fact that we all have animal and human parts of consciousness within us. Our animal structures are geared towards competition, power, possession, and self-interest, whereas our real human parts want to serve, are able to share, are compassionate and prefer...
third.fullText: ...is based on the work of Martinus Thomsen's cosmology and is characterized by the fact that we all have animal and human parts of consciousness within us. Our animal structures are geared towards competition, power, possession, and self-interest, whereas our real human parts want to serve, are able to share, are compassionate and prefer to give rather than take. We carry both within us and both are a natural part of us. Regardless of whether Martinus Thomsen is right in what he perceived and shared after opening his consciousness, it is a very nervous system-friendly world view that can be a great resource for us. If you want to know more about it, you can watch this video or browse Martinus.dk. Martinus himself writes in the preface to his main work that if something else resonates with you more than his cosmology, then something else is just right for you. And you should not follow him blindly but examine for yourself what suits your truth and what serves you. We use cosmology in the forum work as a supportive tool that is allowed to play a part where it is welcome.

fourth.title: Building a global network
fourth.par: The forum is a feel, do and think tank that envisions a trauma-informed and nervous system-oriented social transformation. It explores and takes the next steps towards it and creates the necessary offers to accompany people from all areas of society in the transformation. It is a global and local knowledge and networking platform...
fourth.fullText: The forum is a feel, do and think tank that envisions a trauma-informed and nervous system-oriented social transformation. It explores and takes the next steps towards it and creates the necessary offers to accompany people from all areas of society in the transformation. It is a global and local knowledge and networking platform that brings together actors in the field from civil society, the health sector, education, politics, and business like a prism and promotes joint, sustainable, and effective action.

fifth.title: What does the forum offer?
fifth.par: The Forum is gradually building up a pool of trainers, organizing events, building networks, offering online and offline training, nervous system-oriented advice and support, and developing an attractive interactive self-learning area.
fifth.fullText: The Forum is gradually building up a pool of trainers, organizing events, building networks, offering online and offline training, nervous system-oriented advice and support, and developing an attractive interactive self-learning area.

first.name: Franziska Siebert
first.text: Sociologist at open-air laboratory - As an event manager in the nature community, I am a link between the forum and the world of ecovillages and communities. I am fascinated by how strongly unconscious trauma structures influence our community life and what happens when we turn to the wounded and hidden parts. For me as an individual, for my relationships and for our community, great healing potentials arise through this process of awareness and I strive to make this potential available for all people.

second.name: Susie Wimmer
second.text: As a performer, clown, workshop leader and much more, I design the  introductions to the centrepiece of the Forum's work, the Shadow Love -  Research Workshop, and invite You to explore impossible possibilities, passionate failure, the tangible in nothingness and the joy of sense in nonsense.

third.name: Nikola Buric
third.text: I am a network weaver dedicated to driving systemic change through grassroots movements and citizen-led initiatives. With a background as an Environmental Engineer, I am deeply committed to advocating for regenerative practices that restore ecosystems and foster resilient communities.

fourth.name: Ljubica Babic
fourth.text: I'm a former architect with over 13 years of extensive experience working in UAE and Serbia. Due to my personal development and since I got to know the Forum for Trauma and Nervous System, I'm deeply interested in our inner architecture and inner work. I'm passionate about spirituality, connecting people and technology, and I'm excited to be part of the Forum.

fifth.name: Achim König
fifth.text: I am the source of the forum vision. My passion is to find out what  happens in the hidden and unconscious and how we can create awareness  there. Besides my sparkling skills in coaching and training, I love to  laugh at myself, hold spaces and other people, be spiritual, talk and do  nonsense and bring the love that radiates through me into life.

first.name: Sayaka Schmuck
first.text: I feel very safe in the coaching sessions and am always totally enthusiastic and fascinated by where the journey leads.

second.name: Ananda Lena Kupsch
second.text: It was very nice to be allowed to be human and to be accepted as I am - with my light and dark sides.

third.name: Raja Brasen
third.text: In a relaxed and honest atmosphere my own vulnerability was a central theme that connected me with the others.

fourth.name: Franziska Siebert
fourth.text: I was particularly impressed by how much pleasure and ease with which we addressed our 'mistakes' and shadow parts - I have rarely experienced such a friendly and safe space!

fifth.name: Ljubica Babic
fifth.text: Rarely is there a workshop where all of the talks are incredibly useful. I found it really thought provoking and stimulating.

FooterBanner.heading: How can you join in?
FooterBanner.par: There are many ways to help shape the forum. You can become active as a trainer, join or found a local group, you can help build the club, you can become part of the forum movement with your organization or support us with your ideas, your commitment or your money.

Footer.text: Trauma and nervous system awareness as a key to social change.

startingPoint.heading: History of origin
startingPoint.par: If you want to know how the forum vision came about, what a dog, a social worker and a Netflix documentary have to do with it, then click here...
startingPoint.fullText: This is how Achim describes the moment of origin... Shortly before Christmas 2021, I watched the Netflix documentary 'Home', which is about homeless people. In minute 30, a social worker talks to a woman named Patty who has been affected by violence and is in shock and tells her she needs to make an effort for a better future. While the social worker's dog cuddles with the traumatized woman and helps her to regulate herself, the social worker apparently does not know that when the amygdala is activated by great danger, the cerebral cortex is only able to function to a limited extent and Patty cannot hear or understand him properly and in a state of shock has no resources to 'make an effort for a better life'. I was surprised and annoyed that the social worker, trained and paid by the system, did not respond effectively to Patty's nervous system condition while the dog instinctively did everything right and supported Patty effectively. Then I went on to think that not only do social workers have little knowledge about trauma and the nervous system, but this knowledge is lacking in all other systems, from kindergarten to school, hospitals, government agencies and businesses.That night I fell asleep with the concept of this huge collective knowledge gap on my mind. After two hours, I woke up with my heart pounding and my synapses running hot. I was tingling all over and a strong energy flowed through me. The basic outline of the forum emerged. The next day the first brief concept was ready and in the following months more and more details became visible. The forum vision is like a book that decides for itself which page to open and make visible. It feels as if the forum is an independent living being that has turned to me to accompany it into the material and into our lives. I have no copyright on it and the forum belongs to life itself, from which it also springs. It is finished and complete. In contrast to me, who is an unfinished being and only has the task of protecting the forum and accompanying it into life. In doing so, I also have to protect the forum from myself, my ego, and my wounded inner children. Perhaps the forum also protects itself, as the book closed again after a retraumatizing experience and I had to work on my own healing before the book opened again. The forum is so large and so infinitely loving that I can only guess at its outlines. At the same time, it is clear and structured and many possible processes are already visible in detail. As part of life, the forum unfolds independently and I am infinitely grateful that I can be so closely involved in this process, which is carried by a universal, all-pervading love.

banner.heading: Building a Healthier Future
banner.par: Explore trauma-informed, nervous system-oriented solutions for societal change. Join us in shaping a healthier, more equitable future.

first.heading: The forum itself
first.text: ...is based on trauma-informed and nervous system-oriented principles in both its professional and voluntary structures. In addition to the content of the work, the focus is on ensuring that the work processes and methods have a positive, regulating effect on health. The forum is therefore a field of research and development for regenerative work methodology that combines New Work approaches with the latest findings on the nervous system. The forum also offers nervous system-friendly and trauma-integrating spaces for groups.

second.heading: The forum as a knowledge platform
second.text: ...networks with existing (scientific) structures, prepares trauma and nervous system-oriented knowledge and makes it accessible and understandable for a public beyond the professional world. In addition to scientific knowledge, the aim is to develop and disseminate specific nervous system-oriented solutions for politics, business, the health, education, and social sectors. Some of these solutions already exist and in some cases the scientific findings still need to be translated into concrete options for action. In addition to specialists and managers, the forum also addresses private individuals through brochures, social media, etc. In addition to professionals and managers, the Forum addresses private individuals and promotes nervous system-friendly options for 'personal use' in partnerships, education or in dealing with oneself.

third.heading: The forum as a training center
third.text: ...develops tailor-made training concepts for the various areas and trains trainers* to implement them. These will be, for example, tailored training courses for teachers, social workers, politicians, managers, or people active in social policy.

fourth.heading: The Forum as a social movement
fourth.text: ...identifies nervous system orientation as a decisive common denominator and a common objective of all social transformation movements. This is because social structures that are more appropriate to the nervous system have a positive impact on health, educational justice, environmental awareness, and conflict transformation. Nerve system-based approaches flow into the various socio-political movements and a separate movement is forming that has the vision of a global society that is more nervous system-friendly as its own central main goal.

fifth.heading: The forum as a lobby structure
fifth.text: ...has two pillars. One is a constantly professionalizing lobby organization that promotes nervous system-based approaches within existing structures in the municipality, the state, the federal government and beyond. The second pillar is - in the long-term perspective - a global party that, on the one hand, campaigns for a society that is more compatible with the nervous system, but on the other hand does not adapt to the existing political structures. More important than achieving concrete election results is to establish an alternative political style that focuses on solidarity and 'wellbeing' instead of generating power.

sixth.heading: The local groups
sixth.text: ...have three levels of impact. They offer spaces for self- and co-regulation. And they create opportunities for civic engagement by networking with other civil society actors on the ground and promoting approaches based on the nervous system. They also have a targeted impact on municipal structures, influence the local political agenda and contribute to wellbeing in the municipality.

banner.heading: Learn Our Principles
banner.par: The principles are the foundation on which the Forum is  built. They give us orientation, inspiration and enable us to act  coherently.

first.heading: The principle of the 2 pillars
first.text: The forum swings like a pendulum between the pillar of “going outward“ in the form of passing on knowledge to society and the pillar of “going inward“ in the form of creating safe spaces in which we look within ourselves and perceive our shadows and integrate, back and forth.

second.heading: Storytelling
second.text: The forum brings together the issue of trauma with the issue of social justice and creates a powerful vision of a trauma-informed, fairer and more peaceful society with effective social systems.

third.heading: Avoiding shame and maintaining self-image
third.text: ...are powerful driving forces within ourselves that cause us to ignore the aspects of reality that draw our attention to our own inner pain and reflect our own incompleteness. To avoid shame and maintain our self-image, we create stories about ourselves and the world. In the forum we discover and question these stories. We are honest with ourselves and others and treat each other lovingly from the start as vulnerable and unfinished beings. We draw our strength from this honesty and transparency and meet the outside world on an equal footing.

fourth.heading: Multiperspectivity
fourth.text: The central starting point is to focus on the perspective of those "affected" by the support systems and not to make the process of knowledge generation and transfer in a “white“ educated middle class bubble. We are aware of the limitations of our own perspectives and try to integrate as many social perspectives as possible into the forum.

fifth.heading: The harmony principle
fifth.text: Controversial discussions and the emergence of intense feelings are warmly welcomed and are part of a healthy and lively energy body. Power struggles are not part of this healthy liveliness. Striving for power can and should be reflected in a safe space and transformed into growth. However, it is not possible to change the foundations of the forum along its journey. If there are internal breaks with the forum, there can and will be farewells and reunions. Anyone who cannot support the forum can take a different, own path for a while until their soul can reconnect with the forum again.

sixth.heading: The scaling and effectiveness principle
sixth.text: Everything the forum builds is designed to be as scalable and effective as possible. Knowledge about trauma should be fed into the systems at the nodes with the greatest reach. To this end, political and civil society structures are specifically involved. Local groups work within their sphere of influence, use the citizens' consultation hours of their representatives and local networking structures to promote centrally controlled campaigns. Working groups and political alliances emerge. In the accompanying training sessions, in addition to the cognitive level, the heart level and the cellular level are also addressed.

seventh.heading: The principle of transparent shadows
seventh.text: Our inner shadow parts are welcome. Instead of hiding them, we bring them to light and practice lovingly integrating them into our self-image. Non-transparent shadow parts are dangerous for the forum because they prevent trauma integration. We will often not meet our demands because this does not allow our development as individuals and as energy bodies. We make the discrepancy between expectations and reality transparent. We will also receive financial support generated by exploitative capitalist means. We also make the shadows of the resources made available to us transparent.

eighth.heading: The principle of organic hierarchy
eighth.text: The forum presents itself to us in varying degrees of clarity. The more clearly someone can see and feel the forum, the more decision-making authority that person has. The forum is flexible and clear in its work. It will grow quickly. The slowness of grassroots democratic decision-making is not suitable for the forum in the first few years. The 2 pillar principle provides safe spaces for slowness, pause, feeling and healing.

ninth.heading: The principle of listening
ninth.text: Every being can and should contribute to the forum according to their abilities and interests. Where does my soul and body feel in the right place. We listen within ourselves, into the universe and into life to hear what we are being called to do. This can create new fields of action. Inside and outside the forum.

tenth.heading: Spirituality
tenth.text: In the forum we practice connecting with our higher selves. Free from religious dogmas, we establish a spiritual practice that is absolutely voluntary and also pleasant for atheists

eleventh.heading: Regenerative work
eleventh.text: We try to adapt the workplaces to the individual needs of the nervous system and to design the working conditions, including the salary structure, in a joint process.

twelfth.heading: Research space for social transformation
twelfth.text: Our aim is to open up a research space for sustainable social action and new social structures. We see a need to contribute to change because we recognize that a nervous system-oriented and trauma-sensitive life and work is made more difficult by the current social economic and social system.

banner.heading: Transforming Society Together
banner.par: The forum is gradually building up a pool of trainers, organising  events, building networks, offering online and offline training, nervous system-oriented advice and support and developing an attractive  interactive self-learning area.

first.heading: Trainers pool
first.text: There will be a pool of certified trainers who will cover both the online courses and can be booked for individually designed learning processes for organizations.

second.heading: Online courses
second.text: Courses will be bookable here (hopefully free of charge) for beginners and advanced learners, moderated learning, practice, and exchange groups. As well as specific courses for various disciplines in healthcare, education, or business. And all this seven days a week at different times of day and as soon as possible in other languages.

third.heading: Science networks
third.text: ...are supported by the Forum in order to interweave the various strands of research more closely.

fourth.heading: Structural consulting
fourth.text: Here, larger structures such as municipalities, universities, federal states or (federal) politics and later also the EU institutions will find a range of consulting and support services.

fifth.heading: Events
fifth.text: Conferences, training sessions, annual groups, etc.

sixth.heading: Self-study area
sixth.text: In this area you will find videos, lectures, case studies and exercises, learning groups and probably at some point a three-dimensional metaverse as an interactive learning space.

seventh.heading: Model projects
seventh.text: We do not yet know what a nursery, school or local authority that is suitable for the nervous system looks like. This needs to be researched through professionally designed and scientifically supported model projects.

Community.heading: Get Connected
Community.text: We are bulding a vibrant community of people who want to make the world more nervoussystem friendly. And you are welcome to join.

Contact.heading: How can you join in?
Contact.par: There are many ways to help shape the forum. You can become active as a trainer, join or found a local group, you can help build the association, you can become part of the forum movement with your organization, support us with your ideas, your commitment or your funds.
Contact.text: Have a question, need help, or just want to share a supportive message? Don't hesitate to reach out—we're here for you! Your thoughts and inquiries are always welcome. 😊

Register.subject: What else do you want to share?
Register.oneInterest: Please select at least one interest
Register.congratsText: Your request to join us was sent successfully and its under our review. We will respond to you over your email address once our crew complete your application.
Register.congratsThird: Meanwhile please continue enjoying our platform.
